title: How To Use SnackbarJS with Rails
summary: SnackbarJS is a fun jquery plugin for showing alerts on the site. This article tells you how to get it to play nice with Turbolinks and Rails.
body:
SnackbarJS is a fun jQuery plugin for showing alerts on the site. Here's how you can get it to play nice with Turbolinks and Rails.

First thing we'll want to do is add the css and js files.

Copy  snackbar.js, snackbar.css (and material.css ) in your /vendors/snackbarjs folder

# application.css.scss
@import "snackbar";

// application.js
//= require snackbar

Next we'll want to get our ruby flash available to our JS. There are many ways to do this. A simple solution is to include a data attribute. 

<body data-flash="<%= flash.to_hash.to_json %>" >

Finally, let's add the JS to make the magic happen. Note that this function will also be triggered by Turbolink's page:load hook.

$(document).on('ready page:load', function(){
  var flash = $("body").data("flash");
  $.each( flash, function(key, value){
    $.snackbar({content: value, style: key, timeout: 10000});
  });
});
And now add the missing styles 
.snackbar.error {
  background-color: red;
}
.snackbar.alert {
  background-color: yellow;
  color: black;
}
.snackbar.notice {
  background-color: green;
}

Done! Want to see more like this? We dabble on GitHub.
